channel.title: Most effective fighting style?
channel.description:
Well, I've been thinking about this for the past few days. Which is the most effective fighting style, by fighting style I mean Karate, Muay Thai, Boxing, Judo, etc.
Well, I [b]PERSONALLY[/b] have come to the conclusion Muay Thai is, for anyone who doesn't know what that is it's an 8 point contact sport, involving knees, elbows, punches, fore-arms, kicks, clinches, shins, and take downs. I am not just saying this because I am a Thai boxer, but I have been doing a little bit of research and watching a few videos of where different fighting styles clash with each other and have it all out in a ring.
[b]Muay Thai vs Mixed Martial Arts -[/b] The Thai fighter would win because he has to be quick, and MMA fighters hold their gloves and hands so slow, and do not block. They throw big arching punches, which is a big no. Now, you'd probably think that the MMA fighter might take the Thai boxer down, and ground & pound their way to victory. But, every Thai fighter is taught Brazilian Jui-Jitsu, and even a lot of MMA, as all Thai boxers are good in the clinch position. Every Thai fighter knows submission moves, and submission-defense. Overall the Thai fighter would be too quick for the MMA fighter. [b] Muay Thai vs Karate - [/b] Karate is a joke, and is not even considered a fighting style, rather a sport.
[b]Muay Thai vs Taek-won-do -[/b] Same as Karate, it is a sport. Too back my statement up, they put a Thai fighter against a Karate fighter. Here's the result: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=VbrYiy3Xe_A [b] Muay Thai vs Jui-Jitsu - [/b] Only way Jui-Jitsu would win in this situation would be if the Jui-Jitsu was able to put a submission move on the Thai fighter, seeing as Jui-Jitsu specializes in that. But, that goes without saying; Muay Thai fighters train for Jui-Jitsu too.
[b]Muay Thai vs Samba -[/b] Samba fighters do not have the fitness and endurance of a Thai fighter, due to their fights being so short. But, Samba is basically Muay Thai sped up 5 times. [b] Muay Thai vs Boxing -[/b] This would be the one that would be the fight to watch, due to the fighting styles being nearly identical. However, the Thai fighter would prevail just because boxers do not take hits on their legs/use their legs, which are definitly one of the most powerful things in a fighters arsenal. Also, elbows would be the decider in this fight.
Anyway, I can't be fucked to compare Thai to every fighting style, but those I have mentioned are definitely some of the most deadliest styles, other than Ninjitsu.
Also: watch this video, look at how many of the Knockouts are from Muay Thai, http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=A0yuWhsCFWU.

item.title: Most effective fighting style?
item.dc:creator: @pko pko
item.description:
@pko wrote:

[quote=“Greeny, post:50, topic:226284”][quote author=pko link=topic=297287.msg3818326#msg3818326 date=1321557149]

Lolling at this old school thread, yz talking big like he’d stand a chance against any bellator bantamweight is a joke…

the most effective fighting style is wrestling. with wrestling, you determine where the fight takes place, therefore you’re in more control than in muay thai, ect.

this tread is so full of fuck
[/quote]Last time i checked, Wrestling wasn’t fighting, it was acting.

Not professional wrestling… you dumbass. freestyle/greco roman is the most effective fighting style. if you can hold you’re opponent down and control them effectively while doing damage and avoiding submissions, you’re going to win.

Evidence of your claims?

Let me answer that for you; there is none. Your argument sounds like something from a typical UFC comentary. Fanboys :rolleyes:[/quote]

thats rude… your just mad shogun got knocked out by jon jones #1 p4p

Read full topic

item.title: Most effective fighting style?
item.dc:creator: @Yz85Racer Yz85Racer
item.description:
@Yz85Racer wrote:

[quote=“ThAt0n36Uy, post:37, topic:226284”][quote author=jme link=topic=297287.msg2391282#msg2391282 date=1218977566]

krav maga is supposed to be good.

http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Krav_Maga

I read about it a little and it sounds kind of stupid. Hitting their balls or eyes, etc… lame

How about some good ol’ normal street fighting.
[/quote]

I don’t know, I watched a couple vids of it, and it’s some bad ass stuff. One of the guys was disarming a man with a gun, and he moved so fucking fast I had to watch it 3 times to see how fast he was moving. The get like 18 shots in before the other guy would even land a blow. I would love to see like an actually fight, most of it is like sparring and promo videos. I think a Fight between a MMA fighter and a Black Belt in Krav Maga would be an amazing match. to watch.[/quote]
MMA fighters are pathetic, well a lot of them. Their reflects are terrible, and have no “snap” about them. They’re not fluent with the punching. Only thing they know how to do is get punched in the face 50 times and some how still submit their opponent.

Read full topic

item.title: Most effective fighting style?
item.dc:creator: @ThAt0n36Uy Elijah
item.description:
@ThAt0n36Uy wrote:

[quote=“jme, post:15, topic:226284”][quote author=chrisn2323 link=topic=297287.msg2389433#msg2389433 date=1218918958]
krav maga is supposed to be good.

en.wikipedia.org

Krav Maga

Krav Maga (/krɑːv məˈɡɑː/; Hebrew: קְרַב מַגָּע [ˈkʁav maˈɡa], lit. "contact-combat") is a military self-defence and fighting system developed for the Israel Defense Forces (IDF) and Israeli security forces derived from a combination of techniques sourced from boxing, wrestling, Aikido, judo, and karate, along with realistic fight training. Krav Maga is known for its focus on real-world situations and its extreme efficiency. It was derived from the street-fighting experience of Hungarian-Isr...


[/quote]

I read about it a little and it sounds kind of stupid. Hitting their balls or eyes, etc… lame

How about some good ol’ normal street fighting.[/quote]

I don’t know, I watched a couple vids of it, and it’s some bad ass stuff. One of the guys was disarming a man with a gun, and he moved so fucking fast I had to watch it 3 times to see how fast he was moving. The get like 18 shots in before the other guy would even land a blow. I would love to see like an actually fight, most of it is like sparring and promo videos. I think a Fight between a MMA fighter and a Black Belt in Krav Maga would be an amazing match. to watch.

Read full topic
